name: GlycanAge Test
description: Biological age test based on IgG glycosylation patterns. Measures the glycan structures attached to immunoglobulin G, which reflect chronic inflammation and immune system aging. Complementary to epigenetic clocks.

dosage.standard: Dried blood spot, test every 3-6 months
dosage.notes: Simple finger-prick dried blood spot. Measures glycan age (can be older or younger than chronological age). Responsive to lifestyle changes.

keyFindings: IgG glycans change predictably with age and inflammation
Responsive to lifestyle interventions within 3-6 months (faster than methylation clocks)
